name: Estuary Clue A
flavor: The directions were vague at best. This is the north coast, somewhere near Knossos
subtitle: Clue

name: Estuary Clue B
flavor: The directions were vague at best. They said it was close to Knossos, on the south coast
subtitle: Clue

name: Estuary Clue C
flavor: The directions were vague at best, but they mentioned it was quite far away, north-east of Knossos
subtitle: Clue

name: Estuary Clue D
flavor: The directions were vague at best. It's in the south-east of the island
subtitle: Clue

name: River Course
flavor: The river is eerily quiet. Something isn't right
subtitle: Pursuit

name: River Course
flavor: The river is eerily quiet. Something isn't right
subtitle: Pursuit

name: River Course
flavor: The river is eerily quiet. Something isn't right
subtitle: Pursuit

name: Deadly Shallows
flavor: Even with the upgraded tech Argo has trouble navigating this part of the river
subtitle: Pursuit

name: Maze Canal
flavor: The river becomes a twisting, symmetrical canal
subtitle: Pursuit

abilityText.value: Random Argonaut who is not Mazetouched gains the Mazetouched Affliction

name: Old Maze Canal
flavor: The river becomes a twisting, symmetrical canal
subtitle: Pursuit

name: Populated Maze Canal
flavor: The river becomes a twisting, symmetrical canal. Maze-marked people subsist on both banks
subtitle: Pursuit

name: Reshaped Canal
flavor: The river becomes a twisting, symmetrical canal
subtitle: Pursuit

name: Reshaped Lake
flavor: A lake was made part of the maze canal system. Even the water starts to look... angular
subtitle: Pursuit

name: Symmachy Flagship
flavor: The Symmachy Flagship glistens with light of a hundred torches
subtitle: Pursuit

name: Pristine Minotaur Statue
flavor: There must be a royalist village nearby
subtitle: Clue

abilityText.value: No coordinates here! Random Argonaut gains 1 Despair token

name: Transformed Temple
flavor: Someone reshaped the old statue into something otherworldly and sinister. There's a secret chamber here and in it, a partial map to the Sepulcher Acropolis
subtitle: Clue

abilityText.value: The Map Tile you are currently on designates the latitude coordinate of the Acropolis Sepulcher
Note this Tile's number in the Map section of the Argo Sheet
: If you are told to discard this card by the Story 3A effect, discard another card from the
Then return this card to the deck

name: Daedalus Safehouse
flavor: There's a secret chamber here and in it, a partial map to your destination. What business did Daedalus have with the Sepulcher Acropolis
subtitle: Clue

abilityText.value: The Map Tile you are currently on designates the latitude coordinate of the Acropolis Sepulcher
Note this Tile's number in the Map section of the Argo Sheet
: If you are told to discard this card by the Story 3A effect, discard another card from the
Then return this card to the deck

name: Ruined Minotaur Statue
flavor: The Hornsworn made short work of this statue
subtitle: Clue

name: Forgotten Minotaur Statue
flavor: This old status shows a young Minotaur. The artist rendered him as a beautiful, somewhat effeminate creature
subtitle: Clue

name: Minoan Guide
flavor: Aloof and demanding, the Princess mostly keeps to her quarters
subtitle: Ally

abilityText.value: Various effects may instruct you to make tally marks next to her name
If there are 10 or moretally marks besides Acacallis, see 0043
You may dismiss the Princess at the end of any Voyage Phase

name: Old Spinner
flavor: The wizened woman keeps to herself. When she thinks nobody is looking, she fiddles with her fingers, as if she was rolling a ball of yarn
subtitle: Ally

abilityText.value: You may dismiss the Old Spinner during the Story Step
If you do, discard this card

name: Xenodice Map
flavor: Was it Daedalus's madness, or Xenodice's?
subtitle: Clue

name: Cyclopean Gate Ignition Key
flavor: This sluice gate was built on the ruins of an old cataract outpost
subtitle: Ignition Key

abilityText.value: When you have this card, add +1 to all tests during the Adventure Phase on

name: Eastern Gate Ignition Key
flavor: This sluice gate has sustained damage from repeated Symmachy attacks
subtitle: Ignition Key

abilityText.value: When you have this card, add +1 to all tests during the Adventure Phase on

name: Leonidas Stoa Ignition Key
flavor: Here lies buried Leonidas, one who could not kill the Nietzschean
subtitle: Ignition Key

abilityText.value: When you have this card, add +1 to all

name: Black Gate Ignition Key
flavor: Blackened by regular ambrosia spillages, this gate is mostly used by traders and laborers
subtitle: Ignition Key

abilityText.value: When you have this card, add +1 to all tests during the Adventure Phase on

name: First Cataract Fortification Line
flavor: The First Cataract. This is as far as your advanced scouts got
subtitle: Map

name: Second Cataract Fortification Line
flavor: You can only guess what dreadful landscape awaits you beyond the Second Cataract

name: Fortresses Of Central Lakonia
flavor: Each one an Ares-class behemoth
subtitle: Map

name: Outer Keep
flavor: This keep stands watch over the precarious plains of the Contested Lands
subtitle: Fortress

name: Kyklopes Keep
flavor: Under this fortress, old Cyclopes' bones stir
subtitle: Fortress

name: Central First Perimeter Fortress
flavor: The centerpiece of the First Cataract defense line
subtitle: Fortress

name: Eastern First Perimeter Fortress
flavor: This citadel serves as a prison for Symmachy war criminals
subtitle: Fortress

name: Central Second Perimeter Fortress
flavor: The centerpiece of the Second Cataract defense line
subtitle: Fortress

name: Lakonias
flavor: This fortress was once a beautiful place of contemplation
subtitle: Fortress

name: Fireships
flavor: You've seen this once before. A flaming fleet to boil the sea - and the Argo with it
subtitle: Argophylae

abilityText.value: Place an additional Blockade token on a space opposite the currently used Blockade token (ignore this effect if that's the only viable route)
Discard it at the end of the next Movement Step

name: Boarding Bridges
flavor: Rotating cranes and Ambrosia Elephants powered by ungodly hydraulics are extended over the canal to allow boarding from above
subtitle: Argophylae

abilityText.value: Place an additional Blockade token on a space opposite the currently used Blockade token (ignore this effect if that's the only viable route)
Discard it at the end of the next Movement Step

name: Machinations
flavor: While Argo fights for its life, the Nietzschean advances his master plan
subtitle: Argophylae

abilityText.value: Place an additional Blockade token on a space opposite the currently used Blockade token (ignore this effect if that's the only viable route)
Discard it at the end of the next Movement Step

name: Cyclopean Snares
flavor: Giant-sized mechanical traps from a previous aeon, primed again for Titan hunting
subtitle: Argophylae

name: Ballista Fire
flavor: Day and night, the fire does not cease
subtitle: Argophylae

name: Javelin Gauntlet
flavor: Through a city canal, where the javelins darken the skies
subtitle: Argophylae

abilityText.value: Randomly choose one of your Argo Ability technologies
It is disabled and cannot be used! Write its name as an event on the Timeline, 10 days from now
When you resolve this event, it is repaired and ready to use

name: Hammer & Anvil
flavor: Coralled into a tight canal, with the might of the Nietzschean fleet behind you, you face a Cyclonus enforcer
subtitle: Argophylae

abilityText.value: At the end of the current Step, resolve a regular Cyclonus Battle but
mark it on the Evolution Track
The Cyclonus' level is determined by the last marked box on its Evolution Track
After the Battle, return this card to the box (do not shuffle it into the Argophylae deck when it runs out of cards)

name: Apella Delegate
flavor: A Spartiates representitive who survived the Cleansing
subtitle: Identity

abilityText.value: Clue card to the Identity deck

name: Gerusia Delegate
flavor: To be old and alive in the New World Order, you need to be a god or a monster
subtitle: Identity

abilityText.value: When you have this card, add +1 to all save tests that allow you to mitigate

name: Krypteia Agent
flavor: You see the Krypteia only when it wants to be seen. And then it is too late
subtitle: Identity

abilityText.value: Clue card to the Identity deck

name: Krypteia Spymaster
flavor: Even the Ephors fear the ever vigilant eye of the Krypteia
subtitle: Identity

abilityText.value: When you have this card, the first
Negotation ability you use during the day costs you -1

name: Hippeis Commander
flavor: A Spartiates warrior leading one of the cohorts
subtitle: Identity

abilityText.value: Clue card to the Identity deck

name: Hermes Hoplites Commander
flavor: A Superior Spartiates ordering a force that can bring down a Titan
subtitle: Identity

abilityText.value: When you have this card, each time you use the Expedition ability from the
Technology card, add +1 to the result

name: Ambrosia Extraction Advisor
flavor: An astrologer and alchemist, leader of an Ambrosia Extraction Platform
subtitle: Identity

abilityText.value: Clue card to the Identity deck

name: Ambrosia Processing Overseer
flavor: A tinker and philosopher supervising the refinement of raw ambrosia
subtitle: Identity

abilityText.value: When you have this card, if a Sabotage effect requires you to note an event on the Timeline, note it 5 days from your current day instead

name: Agiad King
flavor: The position of the Agaid King brings the Nietzschean's regime much needed legitimacy
subtitle: Identity

abilityText.value: Clue card to the Identity deck (if available)

name: Eurypontid King
flavor: In Nietzschean's Sparta, even a King is a lapdog
subtitle: Identity

abilityText.value: Clue card to the Identity deck (if available)

name: Ephor
flavor: Ephors are the de facto governors and generals of Sparta
subtitle: Identity

abilityText.value: When you have this card, add +1 to all save tests that allow you to mitigate
Clue card to the Identity deck

name: High Priest Of Man
flavor: The one who did not hesitate
subtitle: Identity

abilityText.value: When you have this card, add +1 to all save tests that allow you to mitigate

name: Bloodied Wreaths
flavor: You have looked into the Abyss and made it blink
subtitle: Title

abilityText.value: When in Sparta, gain +1 to save tests that allow you to mitigate either
The Krypteia assassins have infiltrated your ranks
You are not one of them
, but the evidence suggests there is a spy among you, posing as an Argonaut
Their instructions are printed on the Loyalty card they were dealt
Observe your fellow players carefully, looking for any signs of treachery
At a later point you will be asked to vote which of you is an imposter

, but the evidence suggests there is a spy among you, posing as an Argonaut

, but the evidence suggests there is a spy among you, posing as an Argonaut

name: Map Of The Past
flavor: This is the reconstructed map of Delphi from the time before the Eschaton
subtitle: Map

name: Finish The Prime Lighthouse
flavor: Icarus used his father's lighthouses to guide his ship to the skies, but one failed to activate. Perhaps some of the rare components and alloys of the Argo's hull could repair it before the ill-fated flight..
subtitle: Event

abilityText.value: When you are on tile 32, during the Story Step, lose -1
to repair the Prime Lighthouse ahead of schedule

name: Design A Mazestone Solution
flavor: Icarus's vessel uses a Sirenshell core to contain the paracausal energies of its central machina, but there was a problem with its configuration. Maybe it would be better to use Mazeflesh in its construction..
subtitle: Event

abilityText.value: When you are on tile 46, during the Story Step, gain +1

name: Infiltrate The Expedition
flavor: Icarus needed a Delphian Oracle to plot the Aspirant's course, but the one he chose lacked confidence in his abilities. Maybe another candidate from among the Argo's crew will not hesitate
subtitle: Event

abilityText.value: When you are on tile 42, during the Story Step, lose -1
to replace the Oracle who accompanies the mission

name: Broker A Deal
flavor: While preparing for the Aspirant's mission, Icarus was approached by Symmachy agents with offers of aid and resources. He refused, but perhaps you can convince him to accept instead..
subtitle: Event

abilityText.value: When you are on tile 37, during the Story Step, gain +2
to convince Icarus to accept outside help

name: Provide A Titan
flavor: Some of the Aspirant's larger machina need a colossus to operate them. Icarus used a Gaia-born Titan he captured and tamed himself, but perhaps one of your Titans might be better suited to the task..
subtitle: Event

abilityText.value: When you are on tile 48, during the Story Step, lose -1 Titan to provide the Aspirant with a tamed Titan

name: Donate Refined Ambrosia
flavor: The Aspirant's mission required prodigious amounts of ambrosia to fuel it, but the supplies received contained impurities. The Argo's ambrosia stockpile, however, is of much higher quality, thanks to their recent visit to Sparta..
subtitle: Event

abilityText.value: When you are on tile 54, during the Story Step, lose any 10 Primordial resources to reveal the impurities in the ambrosia stockpile

name: Chariot 1A
flavor: This map shows the possible location of a Sunheir chariot part
subtitle: Map

name: Chariot 2B
flavor: This map shows the possible location of a stolen Exile chariot part
subtitle: Map

name: Chariot 1B
flavor: This map shows the possible location of a stolen Exile chariot part
subtitle: Map

name: Chariot 2A
flavor: This map shows the possible location of a Sunheir chariot part
subtitle: Map

name: Irembihazar
flavor: Oh, Irembihazar, the jewel of the Empire, my gilded love!
subtitle: Search

name: City of Beggars
flavor: The Empire is so wealthy that only the most lazy and stupid are destitute
subtitle: Search

name: The Great Bazaar
flavor: In the Great Bazaar of the Empire, everything is for sale, and for a fair price too!
subtitle: Search

name: Bankrupt Metropolis
flavor: If you fail in the name of the Empire, the Empire will bail you out
subtitle: Search

name: Aristotelian Conquered City
flavor: Equality for all--is that not the very essence of commerce?
subtitle: Search

name: Post-Collapse Palace City
flavor: Even in ruin are our cities the envy of all onlookers
subtitle: Search

If this is the last card played, you've found the Hanging Gardens! See 0094
At the start of Story 2A, without looking, discard 1 card from the City of Splendor deck
You may dismiss Scheherazade at the end of any Voyage Phase
The God-King granted his people the Law of Bargains, so the senseless bloodshed over petty squabbles could end, for he saw them as more than --Babelian Text--yphon
Many games are played across Immortal --Babelian Text--ersia, for its citizens enjoy personal growth and free time, luxuries not afforded previously, under the rule of the gods
So great was the wealth he had accumulated that it became like a second sun, blinding to all but the most wealthy citizens, like --Babelian Text--roesus or Midas
Thus it was hidden by a powerful veil woven of wishes

They are not one of, but the wonder of the World, a symbol of the wealth and power generated by the --Babelian Text--nfinite Growth of Persia's system, and a promise that each and every one of its citizens can either aspire to one day walk its fabulous halls, or simply wait for its opulence to trickle down\n\n--Babelian Text--
The Empire is as the --Babelian Text--un above, brilliant and eternal, and its Great Tower will take us to the stars, so the Infinite Growth can continue to the vacant heavenly realms

name: Stolen Clouds
flavor: The truth of the stolen clouds. Will you help spread the word?
subtitle: Message

abilityText.value: At any time you may cross out 1 Stolen Clouds tally mark to lose -1

name: Unbestowed
flavor: What was uprooted needs to be replanted
subtitle: Message

abilityText.value: At any time you may cross out 1 Unbestowed tally mark to lose -1

name: Day After Tomorrow
flavor: The Aristotelian command has declared victory, yet many continue to fight
subtitle: Message

abilityText.value: Add this Trait to every Cycle IV Battle
When you gain more than 1 Midas token, give 1 of those tokens to another random Titan
If the numbers match, you move the Titan and the Entrance the indicated number of spaces and leave these cards face-up (first the Entrance, then the Titan!)
Then, move the Entrance one additional spaces
Finally, remove any Midas tokens from these cards and move the Titan again for each one you removed
If the numbers don't match and both are odd, move the Entrance by the higher value and place a Midas token on that card
If the numbers don't match and both are even, move the Entrance by the lower value and place a Midas token on that card
If the numbers don't match and one is odd and the other is even, neither the Titan nor the Entrance move
Sadly, as the Empire chases Infinite Growth, time grows shorter:
